text: The Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2016 was the fourteenth edition of the Junior Eurovision Song Contest. It took place at the Mediterranean Conference Centre, Valletta, Malta on 20 November 2016, Maltanese broadcaster Public Broadcasting Services was the host broadcaster for the event. The motto for the contest was "Embrace". == Results == Draw Country Artist Song Language(s) Place Points 01 Zena Donnelly "Bríce ar Bhríce" Irish, English 10 122 02 Anahit and Mary "Tarber" () points === Below is a summary of the maximum 12 points awarded by each country's adult and kids jury. Countries in bold gave the maximum 24 points (12 points apiece from the adult and kids jury) to the specified entrant. N. Contestant Nation(s) giving 12 points 8 , , , , , , , 2 , , 1 N. Contestant Nation(s) giving 12 points 3 , , 2 , , , , , , 1 === Spokespersons === The first votes to be announced were those of the professional music industry jury, announced in the order of performance. The expert juries then announced their votes which had been cast live at the contest. Finally, the points awarded by the kids juries were announced as a total in order of the fewest to the greatest number of points received by each country. The spokespersons are shown below alongside each participating country. # Andrea Leddy # Mika # Juna Dizdari # Mikhail Smirnov # Gaia Cauchi # Milen Pavlov # Antonija Dimitrijevska # Nicoletta Włodarczyk # Ruslan Aslanov # Anna Trincher # Jade Scicluna # Tomislav Radojević # Itay Limor # Sebastian Hill # Anneloes # Loucas Demetriou # Elene Sturua # Christer Björkman, Mads Grimstad and Jedward === References === == Other websites == * Category:2016 in Europe Category:Junior Eurovision Song Contest by year Category:2016 in music
